description: This class is an introduction to programming and program design using the Python programming language.
course.prerequisites: (co-requisite) The lab section provides tutorials, lab exercises and programming projects intended to reinforce the programming and design concepts taught in the course. The lecture and lab will be taught as a single integrated course.

outcomes.outcome: Decompose problems and design program solutions using flowcharts, pseudocode, models, or other tools.
Properly code applications using the fundamental coding structures: sequence, selection, and loops.

objectives.objective:
Use software engineering methodologies and practices to:
a. Decompose a complex problem into modular components using both procedural and object-oriented design practices.
b. Define and provide examples of procedural abstraction.
c. Define and provide examples of encapsulation.
Produce flowchart and pseudocode solutions to solve introductory level programming problems.
Design programs that utilize classes from the standard library (in Java this might include JTextField, DecimalFormat, Math, for example) to solve a variety of programming problems.
Design user-defined methods to augment the standard library in solving a variety of programming problems.
Discuss the difference between public and private access modifiers and their implications in programs.
Distinguish between local variables and class attributes and their accessibility implications.
Utilize all three fundamental programming structures–sequence, decision/selection, repetition–in solving programming problems.
Define the concept of "inheritance" in a programming perspective and provide examples of where it might be used.
Identify the role and variety of constructor methods in programs.
Apply time management strategies critical for success in the business world.
Demonstrate critical problem-solving skills in the debugging of programs.
Trace program flow and predict outcomes.

textbook.title: An Object Oriented Approach to Programming Logic And Design
textbook.author: Joyce Farrell

contact.about:
preferred method of contact is via email. I will respond to emails within 24 hours on weekdays. Published office hours are times when I will be available on Zoom for real-time communication. If you need to meet at a different time, please email me to schedule an appointment.
Discord channels are also available for anytime communication with me and your classmates.

instructor.about: Over 30 years professional experience as a software engineer and program manager. I have worked for large and small companies.
